result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Jerome Fuller

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM Defendant Jermaine Jerome Fuller in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jermaine Jerome Fuller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews competency evaluation status. Attorney Nelsen states Dr Minter was trying to make contact with defendant. State in agreement for another status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from WI Forensics Unit to Judge re: competency evaluation
Letter to defendant from WI Forensics Unit re: Competency Evaluation
Letter from WI Forensics Unit to Judge Thimm re: amended extension
Letter from WI Forensics Unit to Judge Thimm re: extension

ADDRESS INFO for Jermaine Jerome Fuller
Current: 831 E. 4th Street, Apt 511, Duluth, MN 55805 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2022)
Prior: 431 E 4Th St, Duluth, MN 55805

10:18 AM Defendant Jermaine Jerome Fuller in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jermaine Jerome Fuller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Court questions competency evaluation. Attorney Nelson indicates has not filed order yet. Defendant in agreement with completing evaluation. Court adjourns hearings.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order for Competency Examination by Dept of Health Services
Letter from Judge Thimm to Attorney Nelsen
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Exhibit 1 from preliminary hearing - Lab Report

9:29 AM Defendant Jermaine Jerome Fuller in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jermaine Jerome Fuller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. 
State calls first witness, Witness sworn and testified. Officer Finkbeiner, CIty of Superior, August 9, 2021. Superior, Douglas County, WI. Witness identifies Defendant. Court reflects identification of defendant. Attorney cross examines witness. Exhibit 1 marked and submitted, no objection. Exhibit 1 received.  State rests. 
State makes argument for bind over. Attorney makes argument in opposition. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Arraignment. 
Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms they have received date and time of hearing and confirms they will attend. Defendant provided notice.
Arraignment scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Bond posting forms from 21CM241
Bond started at $500 cash and $2000 signature bond on 9/1/21. A warrant was issued 10/22/21 with no less than $2500 cash. Upon appearance later that day, the court reinstated the $500 cash and ordered an additional $2500 for a total of $3000 cash bail.  
Note: Dantey Lowe posted $2500 but forgot to allow for the credit card fee of $119.05 so his posting was short by that amount. Later, Hannah Lee posted the balance, but she posted $125.00 rather than the $119.05 that was owed, so the bail was overpaid by $5.95.
$3,000 already posted. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

3:16 PM Defendant Jermaine Jerome Fuller in court with Michael Charles Hoffman.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledge receipt, waives reading, not guilty pleas, requests preliminary hearing. Misdemeanor to trail. State requests if money from closed case 21CM241 be transferred to this case, $3000 cash, no use of drugs or paraphernalia.
Court orders $3,000 cash, no use or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
